data.title: Can't use 'F12' goto definition for C Lanuage file.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I want to use Visual Studio Code for C programming, after load the top folder of my project, all files has been added, but seems I can't use 'F12' or 'Ctrl + left click' to go to definition across my project files

data.title: TextFileEditorModel tests seldom fail in Appveyor
data.body:
A few PR's hit this every now and then. [Here's the log](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/46134/log.txt).

```
[00:04:35]   1) Files - TextFileEditorModel Change after auto save triggered will cause another autosave and twice the events:
[00:04:35]      Error: timeout of 2000ms exceeded. Ensure the done() callback is being called in this test.
[00:04:35]       at null.<anonymous> (C:\Users\appveyor\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\mocha\lib\runnable.js:189:19)
```

data.title: vscode Version 0.10.2 (0.10.2) - no Intellisense in Razor files?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I can't get intellisense support in Razor files. On purpose?

To be more specific: JS intellisense is there. Missing support for @ tags

data.title: Isidorn/function breakpoints
data.body: Adds function breakpoints to VS Code. Still does not talk to adapter.

data.title: Hide empty folders after apply file exclusions (user settings)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I'm a Unity 3D developer. Although I use file exclusions, it would be nice to hide folder that get empty after file exclusions are applied.

data.title: The program freezes
data.body:
The problem that causes the software crash continues even after the last update. But I noticed that after finishing some cases the own code, he comes back to work and I come across some error messages.

"Error from the plugin host: write EPIPE"
"Plugin host terminated unexpectedly. Please restart VSCode to recover"
"Error from the plugin host: channel closed"

If I restart the program VSCode happen again, but if I continue to use after finishing processes, can work normally, but can not open the folder from another project.

![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9867694/11447088/879368ec-9527-11e5-9b29-4b4c11d94a2b.png)

data.title: Touching TextEdit's are not being applied
Option to disable current line highlight
data.body: Whenever I place my cursor on a new line, VScode puts a border around it. Is there any way to shut the line bordering down?

data.title: Fixes to editorconfig
data.body:
- Define `indent_size` so it will indent properly on VSCode. ([reference](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/425#discussion_r45710574))
- `package.json` always uses 2-space indentation. ([reference](https://github.com/npm/npm/pull/3180#issuecomment-16336516))

data.title: Paramter hints do not reappear on ,
data.body:
- Typescript - invoke a method - paramter hints show up
- If I trigger inteli-sense to fill in the first argument parameter hints will never show up again
- I would expect parameter hints to show up again once I do a **,** (comma)

This behavior makes parameter hints not very usable for me. Before it was behaving better.

data.title: do not get intellisense for constructors (or overloads) in referenced dll
data.body:
using Version 0.10.2 (0.10.2) on mac os x 10.11- I'm using one of the unity3d integration plugins (on the unity side) and getting autocomplete/intellisense, but not on the unity engine .dll or other referenced dlls in my projects, when using constructors. I expect to see parameter info for the constructor.

If I hold control over the type I get the first overload with no way to switch to others.

if I press control+ space I get autocomplete window but nothing to do with the constructor

data.title: [c++] Syntax highlighting gets confusing when defining a reference to an array.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If a function's parameter is a reference to an array of constants, the data type will be recognized as a function declaration:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16049823/11446150/20fcb222-956e-11e5-98ed-31846c9e14ec.png)

If a reference to an array of constants is defined in a block, the data type will not be highlighted:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16049823/11449777/e2181876-95bd-11e5-86d2-36e44139cdea.PNG)

If a reference to an array (not constant) is defined in a block, the data type will be recognized as a function call:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16049823/11449690/3100d36e-95ba-11e5-8974-11be8480d981.PNG)

Version of VS Code: 0.10.2

Color theme: Dark(Default color theme)

data.title: Cursor position not maintained after returning TextEdit[] from provideDocumentFormattingEdits
data.body:
I would have expected the cursor position to be maintained (as best it can in case it falls within a delete range) after applying a set of TextEdits returned by APIs such as `provideDocumentFormattingEdits`.  

Instead, I am seeing the cursor remain at the same absolute offset relative to the beginning of the source in the final result, which results in moving the logical location in source text where the user was editing.

Can Code automatically handle this when it applies `TextEdit[]` objects?  Or should extensions be adding their own logic to try and compensate for this?

data.title: Dark cursor is hard to see on dark background & text color
data.body:
I'm using Visual Studio Code 0.10.2 on Mac OS X 10.11.1 El Capitan. On my external monitor, the viewing angle sometimes makes it impossible to see the dark cursor on top of the dark Visual Studio Code background color.

Could we figure out some way to make the cursor more visible in VS Code?

Cheers,
Trevor Sullivan
Microsoft MVP: PowerShell
http://trevorsullivan.net
http://twitter.com/pcgeek86

data.title: Filter errors / warnings for current file only

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I am viewing the _Errors and Warnings_ (`COMMAND + SHIFT + M`), I should be able to filter the list for only the current file that I am viewing. Right now, it is showing the errors for all files in the currently opened folder / workspace.

In the screenshot below, I am currently viewing a file called `azuredeploy-webapps.json`, but the _Errors and Warnings_ pop-up is showing me warnings for a different file called `azuredeploy.json`.

![screen shot 2015-11-27 at 9 50 44 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/466713/11445783/6e7d8224-94ec-11e5-8b87-887c24f7f520.png)

Cheers,
Trevor Sullivan
Microsoft MVP: PowerShell
http://trevorsullivan.net
http://twitter.com/pcgeek86

data.title: expose trigger character to signature help and completion provider
data.body: Add a `CompletionContext` and `SignatureHelpContext` which contains the character that has triggered that request: `{ ch: string }`

data.title: Allow to save with UTF-8 + BOM encoding
data.body:
In version 0.10.2 I am having issues with making sure a file is saved with UTF-8 and BOM character encoding.

Please add such an option.

data.title: Question: Where in the code is 'Install Extension'?
data.body:
I'm working with implementing functionality around QuickPickItem and would like to add indicators and links in a similar way, readme, download and last updated

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/67258/11443986/de2746d4-94ef-11e5-9fd0-4eb300222f3d.png)

data.title: Feature request: command to focus "other" editor
data.body:
Howdy!

I see workbench actions for focusing left, right, or by a specific index, but not one to just hop to the "other" editor. 
The behavior I'm looking for is to hop between any open editors, but not automatically make another (as when I tried to just keep focusing to the right to see if it would just wrap around).

I'd be willing to work on this myself and generate a PR if someone has a hint on where to start looking into this.

data.title: Deleting a modified file asks if you would like to save the file
data.body: To reproduce: - open a file - make a change - delete the file from the 'explore' panel This results in 2 dialog boxes. First I confirm I want to delete it: Then I'm asked if I would like to save my changes to the deleted file

data.title: wrong typing cursor position
data.body:
![animation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6581089/11443063/8c5c24de-954c-11e5-85af-85ce9837f9af.gif)

When typing in Thai language, the cursor position doesn't move as normal. It cannot navigate forward and backward.

I think this bug might also occur in some other languages.

data.title: Attach an object to a QuickPickItem
data.body: The QuickPick widget is a great extensibility point but I was wondering if there are any plans to allow attaching an arbitrary object to a QuickPickItem which would then be passed along when the item is selected? Thanks!

data.title: "Format Code" missing in new version
data.body:
I have old versio 0.7.20 and I open XML file
I can use RMB (Right Mouse button) to "Format Code" for easy reading.

But after I update to 0.10.2 that is not possible anymore.

data.title: Add -w / --wait Command line argument
on windows, honor comspec env variable when spawning a shell
data.body: PR for issue #597

data.title: Debug console no longer shows Console.log?
data.body:
Sorry if this isn't quite the right place for it, but i just updated vs code and noticed that there is a new debug console window that opens up in code, whereas previously it would open an external command prompt window that displayed everything that was written to Console.log.

Now it just shows the start up path for my Electron application and doesn't show anything else.

Is there a way to enable it with a setting in the launch.json configurations? Or is there something else i need to do.

I mean, its not the end of the world if its no longer there, i just liked it

Thanks

data.title: Odd quotes auto-adding when editing in multi-cursor mode
data.body:
There's an odd behavior currently when using multi-cursor support do change `"` to `'` (for instance).

I basically select the first " and hit `Ctrl+D` to select the next one, then I use `backspace` to delete them and add single quotes `'` instead.

In VSCode this results in the following odd behavior:
![vscode-replace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/542458/11437098/1d4daa6a-94eb-11e5-947c-3f105b7da36f.gif)

Sublime Text instead seems to handle this:
![sublime-replace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/542458/11437128/64f5da9a-94eb-11e5-865c-4fc20b64e25a.gif)

data.title: Joh/execute command
